findings.title: Cross-chain execution targets not validated
findings.description: The verifyAndExecuteTx function executes arbitrary calls to any contract with any data. An attacker can target the bookkeeper or other privileged contracts to modify permissions.
findings.impact: Complete bridge takeover by modifying keeper to attacker-controlled address.
findings.recommendation: Whitelist allowed cross-chain call targets. Never allow cross-chain messages to call privilege-management contracts.

findings.title: Bookkeeper can be modified via cross-chain call
findings.description: The changeKeeper() function only checks that caller is crossChainManager, but crossChainManager executes arbitrary external calls. This means anyone who can submit a cross-chain message can change the keeper.
findings.impact: Privilege escalation leading to full fund drainage.
findings.recommendation: Require multi-sig or timelock for keeper changes. Don't allow via cross-chain execution.
